locale.message: Integrate OJS with Matomo, a free and open source web site traffic analysis application. Requires that Matomo is already installed. Please see the Matomo site for more information.

With this plugin enabled Matomo may be used to collect and analyze web site usage and traffic for this journal. Please note that this plugin requires that Matomo is already installed. Please see the Matomo site for more information.
The full url to your Matomo installation (i.e. http://myserver.net/piwik).
Please enter a valid url. Include http:// at the start.
Within Matomo, click on Settings -> Websites. The site profile ID is displayed next to your site profile name.
Please enter a site profile ID.

With the following settings you can operate the Matomo Tracker GDPR compliant. This includes that the user is asked via "consent banner" whether he agrees to the collection and use of personal data and the use of tracking cookies. It is possible to operate Matomo in Opt-In (Consent required) or Opt-Out mode. Opt-In means that the visitors of the website must give their consent before data is transferred to the Matomo server and a cookie is placed. The setting of a tracking cookie can also be waived completely by an option. You should only adjust the following settings in consultation with your data protection representative and check whether the data is transferred correctly to your Matomo server.

The following settings are possible:
  • Enable GDPR compliant tracking:Activates GDPR compliant tracking and the "consent banner". If this option is deactivated, all following settings are ignored and your Matomo tracks not GDPR compliant!
  • Enable Require Consent:This option should be activated for the "privacy by default" policy of the DSGVO. This means that website visitors are not tracked until the tracking has been explicitly agreed to (opt-in). If this option is deactivated, website visitors are tracked until the tracking is explicitly declined (Opt-Out). Matomo writes the following about this: In the context of the GDPR privacy regulations, when you are processing personal data, in some cases you will need to ask for your users' consent. To identify whether you need to ask for consent, you need to determine whether your lawful basis for processing personal data is "Consent" or "Legitimate interest", or whether you can avoid collecting personal data altogether. We recommend to learn more about the lawful basis under the GDPR for Matomo.
  • Enable Cookie free tracking: It is possible to operate Matomo without cookies. Select this option for this purpose. But this has disadvantages which can be read here.

This plugin places a functional cookie in which the decisions made by the visitor regarding the collection of his data are stored. As long as the cookie has not expired, the banner will not be displayed and the user will not be asked for his consent again. The duration can be specified here in days, e.g. 365 if the settings are to be saved for a year.
The banner can be placed at the top or bottom of OJS.

The content of the banner must be entered here. Links and other HTML elements are allowed. The color of the link can be changed in the further options, as this is not possible here using the WYSIWYG editor. Editing the HTML elements in the source code view is also possible.
For example, if you have a link to your Terms in your banner, you can adjust the color of the link here.
Here you can adjust the texts and colors of the accept button (right).
Here you can adjust the texts and colors of the decline button (left).
